Restore timestamps

Source: R/Operations.R
restorePosixct.Rd

This function has been deprecated since Andromeda v0.5 preserves POSIXct datetimes.

restorePosixct(x)

Arguments

x

A numeric vector representing timestamps

Value

A vector of type POSIXct.

See also

restoreDate()

Examples

myData <- data.frame(startTime = as.POSIXct(c("2000-01-01 10:00", 
                                              "2001-01-31 11:00", 
                                              "2004-12-31 12:00")))
andr <- andromeda(myData = myData)

andr$myData %>% 
  collect() %>%
  mutate(startTime = restorePosixct(startTime))
#> Warning: There were 2 warnings in `mutate()`.
#> The first warning was:
#> ℹ In argument: `startTime = restorePosixct(startTime)`.
#> Caused by warning:
#> ! restorePosixct has been deprecated since Andromeda v0.5 preserves datetimes.
#> Please do not use this function.
#> ℹ Run dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings() to see the 1 remaining warning.
#> # A tibble: 3 × 1
#>   startTime          
#>   <dttm>             
#> 1 2000-01-01 09:00:00
#> 2 2001-01-31 10:00:00
#> 3 2004-12-31 11:00:00
# # A tibble: 3 x 1
# startTime          
# <dttm>             
# 1 2000-01-01 10:00:00
# 2 2001-01-31 11:00:00
# 3 2004-12-31 12:00:00

close(andr)
